p: To date, with the exception of consistent evidence of cognitive/mood effects for sage, Lemon balm and rosemary, the psychoactive potential of many of the remaining edible aromatic Lamiaceae species remain under-investigated. One of the most promising groups of plants in this respect is the Mentha genus and, in particular, Mentha spicata (spearmint) and Mentha Ã— piperita (peppermint); which are widely used as food components, flavourings and for their medicinal properties. The latter include uses as antispasmodics [ 17], anti-emetics [ 18] and treatments for irritable bowel syndrome and as topical analgesics [ 19].
